alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 3:39AM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches. Highest amounts in the Park City area and in the Ogden Valley. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Wasatch Back. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Briefly heavy snow and strong winds are expected late Tuesday afternoon and early evening as well as late Wednesday afternoon and early evening. Snow squalls will be possible, bringing strong winds and flash freezing conditions. Multiple additional rounds of snow are expected through the weekend.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.
